function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Embedding contextual information in 3d building models may lead to inaccurate simulation of occupant behaviors and interactions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of trust in virtual human agency and simulated human behaviors may result in skepticism and resistance to using the system for evaluating designs.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in manually adjusting behavior-generating parameters for simulations with many occupants may lead to inefficiency and potential errors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Simulated results from occsim are not yet validated","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider airflow in the built environment","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of crowd behavior model in the simulation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to lack of knowledge about virus transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of transparency in space occupancy and safety","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate cleaning schedules and signage locations based solely on who guidelines, without consideration of simulated contamination frequency.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of virus transmission among building occupants.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Suboptimal placement of air cleaners without consideration of simulated data.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in the built environment due to inadequate space utilization strategies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupant vulnerability in the built environment leading to potential exposure to contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of timeline-based representation in the design process leading to inefficient analysis of design options.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in browsing large contact tracing datasets leading to inefficient data analysis.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of quantification of simulated output leading to inability to score design options based on contamination or infection rate.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of transparency in parameter certainty levels may lead to distrust in the system and customization with lower confidence.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Critical shortcomings in the 3d visualization technique may limit users’ ability to have an overview of the entire space.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying solely on 3d representation for understanding complex behaviors and virus situations may lead to limited insights and understanding of the overall environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for virus transmission through surface-touching and face-touching behaviors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Concerns about the level of randomness in human behaviors in the simulation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Necessity of an explainable interface for occsim agency","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider individualized building layouts and ventilation frequencies for disease control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overwhelming users with too many configurable options","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of covid-19 due to lack of understanding of design factors and their impacts.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for virus transmission in built environments from human interaction","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virtual interviews using zoom due to pandemic lockdown","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharing physical tools mouse and keyboard during system testing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Default simulation time step may not be optimal for modeling contagious diseases with different transmission rates and behaviors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate validation of simulation accuracy may result in unreliable outcomes and recommendations for safe space design and policy-making.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data security and privacy risks associated with the large amount of simulation data stored in a sqlite database.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Accumulated surface contamination from interactable objects","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of interface for customizing contexts","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Manual assignment of tags to 3d objects","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex environmental aspects may impact virus transmission dynamics within the building.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Real-time visualization of air contamination may lead to heightened awareness but could cause undue anxiety among building occupants.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Interactive 3d visualization of virus transmission may lead to privacy concerns and infringement of individual rights.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Customization of occupant properties may lead to inaccurate simulation of virus spread.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Default values for virus properties may not reflect the characteristics of a specific virus, leading to inaccurate simulation results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The visualization methods may oversimplify the complexity of virus transmission in the built environment, leading to misinterpretation of simulation results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contaminated surfaces leading to virus transmission","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate simulation configuration leading to inaccurate results","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective occupant behavior customization leading to increased virus transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of virus particles in the built environment","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagion-related behaviours like breathing, sneezing, and coughing can lead to the spread of air-based contagions in the built environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surface-based contagions from behaviors like surface-touching and hand-sanitizing may lead to the spread of contagious diseases through contact with contaminated surfaces.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Simulating virus-human-building interactions can lead to a better understanding of how contagious diseases spread in built environments, but may also present privacy and ethical concerns related to data collection and monitoring.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dynamic human-building interactions facilitate virus transmission and contagion-related behaviors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virtual humans with agency behaving realistically within the building model can simulate virus transmission scenarios.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Modeling contagion-related human behaviors within the building can provide insights into virus spread dynamics.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
